docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, July 17 -- The recent disclosure that the United States Defense Department was financing academic research in Latin America as part of the struggle against Communist subversion has produced an embarrassing problem for United States...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, July 17 -- The recent disclosure that the United States Defense Department was financing academic research in Latin America as part of the struggle against Communist subversion has produced an embarrassing problem for United States cultural exchange programs.

docs.snippet: Negotiations between the central bank of Uruguay and leading commercial banks here concerning the recasting of $50 million in Uruguayan debt with the banks have come to a standstill, the head of the Uruguayan financial mission disclosed last night.

docs.snippet: The twice-postponed meeting of foreign ministers of the Organization of American States has been postponed again, this time indefinitely. Whatever the official excuses, the real reason is that there was nothing fruitful to talk about. State...
docs.lead_paragraph: The twice-postponed meeting of foreign ministers of the Organization of American States has been postponed again, this time indefinitely. Whatever the official excuses, the real reason is that there was nothing fruitful to talk about. State Department officials doubtless breathed sighs of relief, for a conference on the planned date of Aug. 4 would have been more embarrassing than useful.
docs.abstract: ed holds postponement unavoidable in view of Dominican situation

docs.snippet: Alberto Morillo, senior member of the Uruguayan central bank mission here to recast some $50 million of debt owed to a number of leading banks, left unexpectedly yesterday morning for Montevideo.

docs.snippet: Reports reaching here yesterday from Montevideo, Uruguay, of the inability of Uruguayan officials to identify Neville Morgan heightened the mystery surrounding the man who has been offering the South American country a loan of $130 million.

headline.main: Man With $130 Million to Lend Is Hard to Find, Uruguay Says
